org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.sync

Class SyncLearning<O,A,AS extends ActionSpace<A>,NN extends NeuralNet>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.Learning<O,A,AS,NN>
      • org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.sync.SyncLearning<O,A,AS,NN>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEpochTrainer, ILearning<O,A,AS>, NeuralNetFetchable<NN>, StepCountable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QLearning

    public abstract class SyncLearning<O,A,AS extends ActionSpace<A>,NN extends NeuralNet>
extends Learning<O,A,AS,NN>
implements IEpochTrainer
    Mother class and useful factorisations for all training methods that are not asynchronous.
    Author:
    rubenfiszel (ruben.fiszel@epfl.ch) on 8/3/16., Alexandre Boulanger

        listener - The listener to add

      • setProgressMonitorFrequency

        public void setProgressMonitorFrequency(int value)

      • train

        public void train()
        This method will train the model

        The training stop when:
        - the number of steps reaches the maximum defined in the configuration (see LConfiguration.getMaxStep())
        OR
        - a listener explicitly stops it

        Listeners
        For a given event, the listeners are called sequentially in same the order as they were added. If one listener returns SyncTrainingListener.ListenerResponse.STOP, the remaining listeners in the list won't be called.
        Events:

        • onTrainingStart() is called once when the training starts.
        • onNewEpoch() and onEpochTrainingResult() are called for every epoch. onEpochTrainingResult will not be called if onNewEpoch stops the training
        • onTrainingProgress() is called after onEpochTrainingResult()
        • onTrainingEnd() is always called at the end of the training, even if the training was cancelled by a listener.
        Specified by:
        train in interface ILearning<O,A,AS extends ActionSpace<A>>

      • preEpoch

        protected abstract void preEpoch()
